hints.content: Let's look at each name to see which ones can classify our shape.

##Square

A square is a quadrilateral with $4$ equal side lengths and $4$ [[☃ explanation 3]].

[[☃ explanation 4]]

This shape is a quadrilateral but it does **not** have $4$ sides of equal length, so it is **not** a square.

options.explanation:
We call a corner a right angle if we can fit a little square perfectly inside it.

Here is an example of a shape with $2$ right angles: 

![A shape with 4 sides. Two corners are labeled Right angle and 2 corners are labeled Not a right angle.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f8081758208a0824fab2ae3e0aa5470ed9d0053e)
![3 squares of different sizes. All squares have 4 equal sides.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c89a31fc913d5ff08b7b4c655e077f40d5170d66)

hints.content:
##Trapezoid

A trapezoid is a quadrilateral with *at least* one pair of parallel sides.

The shape is a quadrilateral with exactly one pair of parallel sides, so it *is* a trapezoid.

[[☃ explanation 2]]

options.explanation: ![3 shapes with 4 sides. At least 2 sides are parallel.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4fa88e89df700b2553f1790bd642f72179be5ccf)

hints.content:
##Triangle

A triangle is polygon $3$ sides.

The shape has $4$ sides,  so it is **not** a triangle.

[[☃ explanation 3]]

options.explanation: ![Three triangles of different sizes. All triangles have 3 sides.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c45b54564065ad81025549d707e6113a7f936e22)

hints.content:
The following names can classify the shape:

- Trapezoid

question.content:
**How can we classify the following shape?**

![A shape with 4 unequal sides. 2 sides are parallel.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/321c01307f0f597b65f3af81aa7c3958fedc480c)
